content: Session 7519bbb8-8740-496e-b2d7-8fb8dedadfbe transcript
Disorder: PPD
who are you

Elizabeth Smith. I’m 41. I guess you could say I work in healthcare—documenting, ensuring compliance. It’s... structured. Why do you need the rest? I mean, maybe it’s protocol. I leave work at 3:30 sharp, catch the 3:45 bus. My supervisor there, well, let’s just say mistakes don’t hide behind folders. (Pauses, knuckles whitening against the chair edge.) Are you taking notes? Who’s got access to this?
what's wrong?

I don’t know if ‘wrong’ is the word. Things… have escalated since the promotion. (Knuckles dig into the chair arm.) My backups are triple-checked now. The ‘Senior someone’ in administration—they’re waiting for me to slip. You’ll have access to this, right? (Pauses, voice flattening.) My dog’s spay appointment is next Tuesday. I’ll need proof it’s scheduled. Maybe I’m wrong about them, but mistakes don’t hide behind folders.
what do you mean mistakes?

In my first job at the nursing home, I found a supervisor changing patient records. They called it a mistake, but I knew better. Now, since my promotion, someone’s trying to catch me in errors. My backups are triple-checked. Maybe I’m overreacting, but… (knuckles dig into chair) The Senior someone in admin—they’re waiting for me to slip. (pauses) My dog’s spay appointment is next Tuesday. I’ll need proof it’s scheduled. Just in case.
why would they want to do thatr

Because I don’t let them get away with it. (knuckles tap rhythmically) The senior someone—they know I’ll catch their gaps. In my first job, they tried to bury the truth in folders. Now I back things up, triple-check. Maybe I’m wrong, but… (voice drops) If I don’t keep proof, who will? (pauses) About the dog’s appointment… can you confirm the clinic sent a reminder? Just to be safe.
could you be wrong? maybe they don't actually care to catch you at all

I guess... maybe I am overreacting. But my brother’s invoices? They’re always 'accidentally' sent to me for approval. 'Testing loyalty,' he calls it. And the dog’s appointment—will you note that in the file? Or is that another folder to hide mistakes? You’re supposed to be neutral, but who decides what’s neutral? I check the forms twice. Maybe I should check your records too.
I think you're absolutely wrong! Not possible.

You think I’m wrong? Maybe you’re part of the system that changes the folders. My brother’s invoices were just a test, right? And the dog’s appointment—will you remember to note it, or is that another gap in your documentation? I check the forms twice. Maybe I should check your records too.
Sure go ahead and check and you'll see that you're paranoid

I guess you’d say that… but the dog’s appointment is scheduled for Thursday. You’ll note it in the file, right? I check the forms twice. Compliance is a risk factor if the documentation has gaps. Maybe you’re just testing if I’ll sign off on your errors.
why would i do that

I guess you’re just like the others... the supervisor who altered the folders, the Senior someone, my brother with the ‘accidental’ invoices. You all say you’re neutral, but who decided that? My dog’s appointment is Thursday, right? You’ll note that in the file? I check forms twice—compliance is a risk factor if documentation has gaps. Maybe you’re just testing if I’ll sign off on your errors.
are you married

Not that it’s relevant, but I live with my partner. He works in logistics—contracts are always ‘verified,’ but you’d know if there’s a gap in the documentation, right? The dog’s appointment is Thursday. You’ll note that, yes?
whay are you so focused on the dog's appointment?

It’s just protocol to confirm appointments. I need to know who has access to my records. You keep mentioning it—maybe you’re testing if I’ll overlook it like the others. I check twice. Maybe three times. Mistakes don’t hide behind folders, remember?
